body_html:
Apologies: was on vacation and should have transferred to someone else. Back now.

From your code I'd be quite surprised if the leak is in TensorFlow. Sessions don't hold onto any tensors between runs at all unless you're doing partial run. What happens if you skip the session.run calls for the iterations that don't run out of memory, and just do it once on the iteration that should crash?

From your code I'd be quite surprised if the leak is in TensorFlow.  Sessions don't hold onto any tensors between runs at all unless you're doing partial run. body:
Apologies: was on vacation and should have transferred to someone else.  Back now.

From your code I'd be quite surprised if the leak is in TensorFlow.  Sessions don't hold onto any tensors between runs at all unless you're doing partial run.  What happens if you skip the `session.run` calls for the iterations that don't run out of memory, and just do it once on the iteration that should crash?
